editstr.c

00001 /**************************************************************************
00002 $Header: EDITSTR.C Fri 10-27-2000 8:53:26 pm HvA V2.01 $
00003 
00004 DESC: String edit routines for HVA_WIN
00005 HIST: 19900818 V1.00
00006           20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for DJGPP
00007 ***************************************************************************/

00009 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00010                         HEADER FILES
00011 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00012 #include <stdio.h>
00013 #include <stdlib.h>
00014 #include <conio.h>
00015 #include <string.h>
00016 #include <ctype.h>
00017 #include "video/v_video.h"
00018 #include "keys.h"
00019 #include "window.h"
00020 
00021 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00022                         PROTOTYPES
00023 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00024 static void display_line(int l);
00025 
00026 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027                         CONSTANTS
00028 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 
00030 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00031                         LOCAL VARIABLES
00032 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00033 static int maxcol = 0;
00034 static int len = 0;             /* Current string length                */
00035 static char disp_str[132];       /* String to display                    */
00036 static WINDOW *w;               /* Ptr to window structure (if wanted)  */
00037 static int startrow,startcol;
00038 static int row,col;             /* Actual row and colum                 */
00039 static int pos;                 /* pointer to next char to edit         */
00040 static int sstart;              /* First character to display ( >= 0    */
00041 static char empty_str[132];  /* Dummy string to clear window         */
00042 static char s[80];              /* Temporary edit string                */
00043 
00044 extern SCREEN _cursvar;
00045 
00046 /*==============================================================================
00047                         START OF FUNCTIONS
00048 ==============================================================================*/
00049 
00050 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00051     FUNCTION: editstr()
00052      PURPOSE: Edit string
00053  DESCRIPTION: Feels like the TURBO integrated enviroment string editing
00054      RETURNS: Last character typed
00055      HISTORY: 900902 V0.3 - x
00056               910716 V0.4 - Adapted for new window enviroment
00057               910826 V0.5 - Now returns last character typed
00058               930101 V0.6 - 3rd parameter is now the length of the window.
00059               931012 V0.7 - Adjust wn_open() for borders including...
00060 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00061 int editstr(int srow, int scol, int l, char *header, char *str, int w_flag)
00062 {
00063   int c_flag = TRUE;     /* Cursor OFF flag              */
00064   int i;
00065   unsigned int key;      /* Scancode of key pressed      */
00066   int key_stat;          /* Key status                   */
00067   int firstkey = TRUE;   /* Flag for for first key press */
00068 
00069   /*----------------
00070     Save variables
00071   ----------------*/
00072   startrow = srow;
00073   startcol = scol;
00074 
00075   if (startrow == -1) startrow = action_row + 2;
00076   if (startcol == -1) startcol = action_col + 2;
00077 
00078   maxcol = startcol + l -1;  /* Maximum column position of cursor     */
00079 
00080   /* CHECK IF WINDOW WITHIN BOUNDARIES
00081   ------------------------------------*/
00082   startcol = minmax(0,startcol,_cursvar.cols-l);
00083   startrow = minmax(0,startrow,_cursvar.lines);
00084 
00085   /* DRAW THE EDIT WINDOW
00086   -----------------------*/
00087   if (w_flag)
00088   {
00089     /*-------------------------------------------------------
00090       l is the number of characters to display,
00091       but use l+2 to reserve space for the '<' and '>'
00092       931012 V0.7: add another 2 for xsize and ysize of window
00093                    to include borders
00094     ------------------------------------------------------*/
00095     w = wn_open(_SINGLE_LINE, startrow-1, startcol-1,
00096                 l+4,3,_window_att,_border_att);
00097     wn_sync(w,TRUE);          /* Set cursor on flag      */
00098     wn_fixcsr(w);             /* Update cursor in window */
00099     wn_title(w,header);
00100   }
00101   else
00102     w = wn_open(_NO_BORDER, startrow, startcol, l+2, 1,
00103                 _window_att,_border_att);
00104 
00105   /*-----------------------------
00106     Clear string s and empty_str
00107   ------------------------------*/
00108   memset(s,'\0',80);
00109   memset(empty_str,' ',l);
00110   empty_str[l] = '\0';
00111 
00112   /*---------------------
00113     Initialize variables
00114   ----------------------*/
00115   len = strlen(str);           /* Determine string length */
00116   strcpy(s,str);               /* Original str will be used with ESCaping */
00117   row = startrow;
00118   col = startcol;
00119   pos = len;                      /* Set character pointer after last char */
00120   col += pos;                     /* Set cursor column                     */
00121 
00122   display_line(l);
00123 
00124   /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00125     After each process the following rules have to be true:
00126 
00127     - pos will point to the next position in the string to process.
00128     - col (cursorcolumn) on the screen will indicate the next position.
00129     - len is the actual lenght of the string
00130   ---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00131 
00132   do
00133   {
00134     /* GET A KEY AND KEYBOARD STATUS
00135     --------------------------------*/
00136     key = waitkey();
00137     key_stat = shift_status();
00138 
00139     /* THREAT FIRST KEYPRESS SPECIAL
00140     --------------------------------*/
00141     if (firstkey)
00142     {
00143       firstkey = FALSE;
00144       if (isalnum(key))               /* Alpha numberic char ?  */
00145       {                               /* Start with new string  */
00146         v_prints(startrow,startcol,empty_str);
00147         s[0] = (char) key;            /* Store key in string    */
00148         for (i=1 ; i<80 ; i++)        /* Fill string with NIL's */
00149           s[i] = '\0';
00150         pos = 1;                      /* Reset string pointer   */
00151         col = startcol+1;             /* Reset column           */
00152         len = 1;                      /* Reset string length    */
00153         display_line(l);
00154         continue;
00155       }
00156     }
00157 
00158     switch (key) {
00159       case ARROW_LEFT:
00160         if (key_stat & (RIGHT_SHIFT|LEFT_SHIFT)) {
00161           col = startcol;
00162           pos = 0;          /* Put cursor on first character */
00163         }
00164         else {
00165           if (pos > 0)      /* Cursor one character to left  */
00166             pos--;
00167           if (!sstart)      /* If not truncated to left ...  */
00168             col--;
00169         }
00170         break;
00171 
00172 /*    --------------  startcol 0 ; l 10 ; len 10 ; maxcol 10
00173       |<012345678_>|
00174       --------------
00175 */
00176       case ARROW_RIGHT:
00177         if (key_stat & (RIGHT_SHIFT|LEFT_SHIFT)) {
00178           pos = len;                 /* Cursor after last character     */
00179           col = min(startcol+len,maxcol);
00180         }
00181         else {                         /* Cursor 1 char to the right      */
00182           if (pos < len) {             /* Stop at end of string           */
00183             pos++;
00184             col++;
00185           }
00186         }
00187         break;
00188 
00189       case RETURN:
00190         strcpy(str,s);
00191         break;
00192 
00193       case BACKSPACE:     /* Delete character left of the cursor */
00194         if (pos > 0)
00195         { if (!sstart)             /* If no left-truncation      */
00196             col--;
00197           pos--;                   /* Generate new string        */
00198           strcpy(s+pos,s+pos+1);
00199           len--;                   /* Adjust length              */
00200           i = startcol+len+1;
00201           if (i <= maxcol)
00202             v_printc(row,i,' ');   /* Delete last char on screen */
00203         }
00204         break;
00205 
00206       case DELETE:                 /* Delete character under the cursor */
00207         if (s[pos] && pos >= 0)
00208         {
00209           len--;
00210           i = startcol+len;
00211           if (i <= maxcol)
00212             v_printc(row,i,' ');   /* Delete last char on screen */
00213           strcpy(s+pos,s+pos+1);   /* Generate new string        */
00214         }
00215         break;
00216 
00217       case HOME:         /* Cursor on first character */
00218         pos = 0;
00219         col = startcol;
00220         break;
00221 
00222       case END_LINE:     /* Cursor after last character  */
00223         pos = len;
00224         col = min(startcol+len,maxcol);
00225         break;
00226 
00227       default:
00228         if (isprint(key & 0x00FF))
00229         {
00230           for (i=len ; i>=pos ; i--)
00231             s[i] = s[i-1];
00232           s[pos] = (char) (key & 0x00FF);
00233           pos++;                 /* Adjust pointer           */
00234           len++;                 /* Adjust string length     */
00235           col++;
00236         }
00237     }
00238 
00239     display_line(l);
00240 
00241   }
00242   while (key != ENTER && key != ESC);
00243 
00244   /* DELETE TRAILING BLANKS
00245   -------------------------*/
00246   i = len - 1;
00247   while (isspace(s[i]) && i>=0)
00248   {
00249     s[i] = '\0';
00250     i--;
00251   }
00252 
00253   /* RESTORE CURSOR AND WINDOW
00254   ----------------------------*/
00255   if (!c_flag) v_cursoroff();
00256   if (w_flag)
00257     w = wn_close(w);
00258 
00259   return(key);
00260 }
00261 
00262 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00263     FUNCTION: display_line()
00264      PURPOSE: Display line for editstr()
00265       SYNTAX: static void display_line(int l);
00266  DESCRIPTION: -
00267      RETURNS: nothing
00268      HISTORY: 24-Feb-1992 10:02:00 V0.1 - Initial version
00269               01-Jan-1993 20:30:11 V0.2 - added parameter 'l' for length
00270 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00271 static void display_line(int l)
00272 {
00273   int i;
00274   int left_flag,right_flag;
00275 
00276   /* SET VARIBLES WITHIN BOUNDARIES
00277   ---------------------------------*/
00278   col = minmax(startcol,col,maxcol);
00279   pos = minmax(0,pos,80);
00280   len = minmax(0,len,80);
00281 
00282 /*    --------------
00283       |<012345678_>|
00284       --------------
00285 */
00286   /* DETERMINE START OF STRING
00287   ----------------------------*/
00288   sstart = max(0,pos-l+1);
00289 
00290  /* CHECK ON TRUNCATION OF STRING
00291   --------------------------------*/
00292   i = max(pos,l-1);
00293   left_flag  = sstart ? TRUE : FALSE;  /* Check left truncation   */
00294   right_flag = s[i] ? TRUE : FALSE;    /* Check right truncation  */
00295 
00296 /*  --------------
00297     |<012345678_>|
00298     --------------
00299 */
00300 
00301   /*-----------------------------------
00302     Initialize the string to display
00303   ------------------------------------*/
00304   s[len] = '\0';                        /* Alway's terminate string  */
00305   memset(disp_str,' ',l);               /* Initialize display string */
00306   strncpy(disp_str,s+sstart,l);         /* sstart is minimal 0       */
00307   strcat(disp_str," ");
00308   disp_str[l] = '\0';                   /* Alway's terminate display string */
00309 
00310   /*------------------------------------------------
00311     Show the string.
00312     Use startcol+1 to leave space for the '<' sign
00313   -------------------------------------------------*/
00314   v_prints(startrow,startcol+1,disp_str);
00315 
00316   /*------------------------
00317     If truncation, show it
00318   -------------------------*/
00319   v_printc(row, maxcol+2, right_flag ? 0x10 : ' ');
00320   v_printc(row, startcol, left_flag ? 0x11 : ' ');
00321 
00322   /*---------------------------------------------------------
00323     If cursor just after last character of the string, and
00324     this would be just before the '>' sign, then print a
00325     space on this place. This is a fucking exception !
00326   ---------------------------------------------------------*/
00327   if (col == maxcol && !right_flag)
00328     v_printc(row,col+1,' ');
00329 
00330   /*-------------------------------------
00331     Set cursor on the character to edit
00332   ---------------------------------------*/
00333   v_setcurpos(row,col+1);
00334 }
